snippet: A victory for Maine’s sensible campaign law will not stop efforts to shield secret political donations.
abstract: Editorial praises United States Court of Appeals for the First Circuit in Boston for upholding the disclosure requirement of Maine’s campaign finance law, which compels an organization to disclose donors when it spends more than $5,000 to influence legislation; laments that the ruling will not stop future efforts to shield secret political donations.
lead_paragraph: A victory for Maine’s sensible campaign law will not stop efforts to shield secret political donations.
